topic.title: Calculating the Master Secret for a TLS session
topic.body:
I've got my Wireshark capture session and see the following sent twice from the endpoint:

-Client Hello, which has the Client Random
-Client Key Exchange, Change Cipher Spec, Encrypted Handshake Message
(Interestingly this exchange contains the Pre-master secret instead of coming in the client's response.)

-Server Hello, which has the Server Random
---They agreed upon Cipher Suite: TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

-Certificate, Server Hello Done
---The server sends 3 certificates, which I extracted from the captured packets.
-Change Cipher Spec
-Encrypted Handshake

So I am looking at all three 'legs' of the 'security triangle', and I understand how they all fit together. Client Random + Server Random + Pre-master Secret = Master Secret. 

Is there a utility/tool to take the data I have and get the master secret for that session?

topic.title: Identifying unknown files
topic.body: I have obtained some configuration files for a VOIP device and want to know if there is any information that can be extracted from them. Anyone who wants to try can have them, free of charge.

topic.title: Making a Zerotalk forum specifically for the GME/stock market discussion?
topic.body: Very, very new to Zeronet but wanting to make an uncensorable alternative/backup to Reddit. How do I 'clone' Zerotalk or similar to do so?

topic.title: Where to pitch a business proposal
topic.body:
Have a genuine business idea I'm looking to get funded.

The general idea is to purchase a "INMANIS" model machine from Terahack and then rent it out for password auditing - cash or crypto only. 

I have two problems: the need for funds (~$55,000 for the machine) and someone with enough business knowledge to know how much I should charge and for what services, such as charging per-password or per-hour.

Is anyone interested? Where would be other good places to pitch this on alt/deepnet?

topic.title: "Freedom Flashdrive" for prospective black market businesses
topic.body:
Hit on an idea to help people whose business has been shut down or limited due to the virus panic:

A premade flashdrive image including multiple anonymity network programs (Tor, Zeronet, I2p) and a simple graphical "how to" for users to plug a flashdrive into their Windows computer and access multiple government-resistant networks to reach customers and coordinate business safely.

Is such a thing reasonably possible?

topic.title: $15 drug gets COVID patients off oxygen support in under week – study
topic.body:
https://www.jpost.com/health-science/15-treatment-gets-covid-patients-off-ventilators-in-under-a-week-study-677479

Fourteen out of 15 severe COVID-19 patients who were treated in an investigator-initiated interventional open-label clinical study of the drug TriCor (fenofibrate) didn’t require oxygen support within a week of treatment and were released from the hospital, according to the results of a new Hebrew University of Jerusalem study.

Fenofibrate is an FDA-approved oral medication. The results were published on Researchsquare.com and are currently under peer review.

1627637997_1B6JScbE4NxJHgSVTGGjeNhk157tp.body:
You'll want a Kali Linux "live drive" and to install the WiFite package, for starters.

After that you'll need to capture their handshake and use hashcat to crack it and get the plaintext password. Hashcat will need as many wordlists as you can throw at it (googles ya friend). You'll want an external hard drive at least 1 TB to hold them all.

Don't bother bruteforcing more than ~8 digits, it'll take to long. Don't try hashcat with a laptop unless it's a very high end gaming one, same reason.

If you find the password, log in to their router and try the default username/password for it (google). If that works, set the password to something else and put your MAC address on an always-allowed list, if the router supports it. This will keep them from changing the WiFi password or blocking your device easily, but they can still push a reset button or yank the power.

If you don't understand any of the terms here, do your homework.
